intro: Zieria fraseri subsp. compacta, commonly known as the compact zieria, is a small shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the family Epacridaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit and small, leathery leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white or pale pink flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
